definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Cowart and schlesselman are scheduled to appear before a judge on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 斯科萊瑟爾曼和科瓦特將於星期三出庭受審。

sentences.english: In criminal cases a q. c. may appear alone .
sentences.chinese: 在刑事案件中，王室法律顧問可以單獨出庭。

sentences.english: Hart is scheduled to appear in court March 10.
sentences.chinese: 哈特將於三月10日出庭受審。

sentences.english: A barrister has right of audience in any court in England and Wales.
sentences.chinese: 律師有權在英格蘭和威爾士的任何法院出庭。

sentences.english: Daniel Taut-Yang Cheung is a practising Solicitor-Advocate.
sentences.chinese: 張達揚是一位律師並擁有出庭能力。

sentences.english: Gina had to appear in court because she witnessed a crime.
sentences.chinese: 吉娜必須出庭作證，因爲她目擊了一件刑案。

sentences.english: He was summoned as a witness.
Jack has been brought before the court on a charge of murder.
sentences.chinese: 傑克以謀殺罪被迫出庭受審。

sentences.english: At first the new jp attends court as an observer.
sentences.chinese: 起初，那位新上任的治安官以觀察員的身份出庭。

sentences.english: The district judge summoned Yinling to appear in the court.
sentences.chinese: 地方政府法官傳喚嬰寧出庭。

sentences.english: The procuratorial personnel of the people's procuratorate shall be no less than 2 when performing their duties in a court.
sentences.chinese: 人民檢察院檢察人員出庭履行職責時，不得少於二人。

sentences.english: Summons is a written notification that one is required to appear in court.
sentences.chinese: 傳票是一種要求某人出庭的書面通知。

sentences.english: He was summonsed to appear in court.
And about 11 investors who purchased the debentures will also testify.
sentences.chinese: 另有約11名購買了麥博債券的投資者會出庭作證。

sentences.english: Other witnesses may be called to testify about conversations with the accused.
sentences.chinese: 其他證人出庭可能是爲了就與被告的談話作證。

definition: to retire from the courtroom/to adjourn
to retract testimony/to withdraw a confession
examination of the evidence of the opposing party in a court of law
